programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S3 - "Space Shuttle Documentary"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli speaks with five astronauts who ventured into space aboard this amazing and complex spacecraft.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S3 - "What Makes a Planet?"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli looks at many objects that, regardless of definition, look like new and fascinating planets.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S3 - "A Space Station for All"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli explores what kind of experiments are being conducted on the International Space Station that will benefit humans on earth.

programme.title: Xploration Outer Space S3 - "Mars vs. the Moon"
programme.desc: Host Emily Calandrelli investigates this dilemma which will determine our space-faring future.

programme.title: Dictators' Hideouts S1 - "Hitler's Last Secret"
programme.desc: Thanks to secret, recently discovered microfilm, Hitler's last secret is revealed: a sprawling underground headquarters at Książ Castle.

programme.title: World’s Best Electric Cars
programme.desc: Alexis Conran investigates as the World gears up to make the switch from diesel and petrol to electric cars.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S2 - "Drones"
programme.desc: The sky is the limit as host Chuck Pell discovers how drone technology is saving the lives of thousands in disaster sites around the world.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S2 - "Future Law Enforcement"
programme.desc: Host Chuck Pell experiences a forger’s nightmare when his handwriting is analyzed with the latest computer software.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S2 - "The Future Explores The Past"
programme.desc: Host Chuck Pell sees how archeologists are using satellite imaging and 3D sensing to map ancient native American cities.

programme.title: Xploration Earth 2050 S2 - "The Fascinating Future Of Growing Food"
programme.sub-title: The Fascinating Future Of Growing Food
programme.desc: Host Chuck Pell introduces us to developments going on in labs, research farms, plant genetics and something called aquaponics to enhance our ability to grow food.

programme.title: Disruptive Behaviour
programme.desc: Reuben Christian travels to Istanbul to meet the innovators who are changing the city and discover how technology is disrupting the old order.

programme.title: Rethink S1 - "Zeno’s paradox and The UV - A Blacklight"
programme.sub-title: Zeno’s paradox and The UV - A Blacklight
programme.desc: In a world where nothing is what it seems, we’ll take a look at magician’s trade secrets, the contradictions of Zeno’s paradox, and the UV - A Blacklight. We’ll take another look at the levitation illusion, and illusionist David Blaine.

programme.title: California Innovation Nation S1 - "Hula Hoop to Hyperloop: Garage Inventions"
programme.sub-title: Hula Hoop to Hyperloop: Garage Inventions
programme.desc: This episode is all about California’s spirit of innovation – where does it come from and what drives it? We consider how many of California’s major brands, companies & innovators started off in garages – from Disney to Amazon.

programme.title: California Innovation Nation S1 - "The Dream Is Dead: Long Live the Dream"
programme.sub-title: The Dream Is Dead: Long Live the Dream
programme.desc: California is one of the most progressive places on earth and has always started conversations about the big questions in society.

programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "The Earliest Americans"
programme.desc: New evidence suggets humans arrived in North America far earlier than previously thoughtm and that they may have traveled along paths now buried deep beneath the sea.

programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "Coronavirus: Don't Blame Bats"
programme.desc: Bats are getting their share of the blame for the COVID-19 pandemic, but are they really at fault?

programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "Peru's Mysterious Cloud Warriors"
programme.desc: Archeologists and geneticists are uncovering surprising details about one of the most mysterious civilizatiions in Pre-Incan South America.

programme.title: Breakthrough S1 - "Decoding Megalodon"
programme.desc: Scientists have concluded that "meg" was able to achieve its gargantuan proportions by starting its carnivorous diet early -- in the womb.

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S4 - "Nightmare on Hollywood Weapons"
programme.desc: Terry and Larry get to test several scenes from Horror films! Terry wants to find out what is the best way to kill a Zombie, just in case he ever ends up in a Zombie Apocalypse, and they will test a scene from the horror classic, Freddie vs. Jason!

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S4 - "All for One!"
programme.desc: Terry travels back in time to see if he can make it as a Three Musketeer! Can he throw his sword and kill the enemy? Can the cross that he wears around his neck stop a bullet? Can a lead ball ignite from a black powder ignite a carriage full of black powder and brandy? Terry enlists the help of his companions to find out!

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S4 - "RED-ish"
programme.desc: Terry takes himself out of “retirement” to test some scenes from RED that will be extremely dangerous. One of which Larry will take great joy in because he gets to fire an RPG at Terry to see if he can shoot it out of the air, and Terry gets to play with a mini-gun again to see if he can cut a van in half!!

programme.title: Hollywood Weapons: Fact or Fiction? S4 - "MacSchappert"
programme.desc: What can Terry do with just a paperclip? Probably nothing, but Larry and Terry will test several scenes from MacGyver, including making an exploding pen, shooting a spear out of a telescope, and they will enlist the help of Andre Ellingson’s Special Effects team to see if they can turn a car muffler into a bazooka!

programme.title: Extraordinary Humans S1 - "The Beast Man / Hawk-Eyes"
programme.desc: The people Thom investigates in this episode claim to harness powers that it was thought existed only in the animal kingdom.

programme.title: Extraordinary Humans S1 - "Human Cat / Human Bat"
programme.desc: Thom meets a man who claims to be the fastest human on all fours and a man who uses a form of echo-location to see the world around him using sound.

programme.title: Extraordinary Humans S1 - "Human Camel / Mega Arm"
programme.desc: Thom tracks down a man who has a right arm bigger than his left and sets another man the ultimate challenge to extinguish are using the water in his stomach.

programme.title: Extraordinary Humans S1 - "Fearless / Iron Chest"
programme.desc: Thom tracks down two more extraordinary humans. One balances on the edges of the world and one attempt to withstand the weight of a crushed car on his chest.

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Tricks S1 - "Mumbai"
programme.desc: Pete Heat in Manchester and visits Old Trafford and for his finale; he wows a group of friends with his unique and comedic magic skills.

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Tricks S1 - "The Best of…"
programme.desc: In the episode you can see the best of Around the World in 80 Tricks.

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "Water"
programme.desc: In India's Ladakh, rising temperatures are leading to glacial melt and water shortages in the mountains of the Himalayas. The Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan is also sturggling as it experiences severe drought.

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "Air: Changing the Atmosphere"
programme.desc: Every year seven million people die from air pollution. It's the world's biggest environmental killer.

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "Food"
programme.desc: In South Africa and Nepal, earthrise looks at food production solutions being developed to help with adjusting to new conditions.

programme.title: Earthrise S1 - "Shelter"
programme.desc: In Colombia and Singapore, earthrise looks at sustainable forms of shelter.

programme.title: The Tech Effect S1 - "Jobs of the Future"
programme.desc: This episode investigates the jobs of the future, and why it might not be long before your co-worker is a robot. As industry changes, companies are identifying ways to re-train their workforce so they can be deployed in new roles.

programme.title: The Tech Effect S1 - "Robotic Engineering"
programme.desc: In this episode, we look at the ways robotic engineers are mimicking the natural world. BionicWheelBot and the BionicFlyingFox have been developed to navigate difficult terrain, like their biological counterparts.

programme.title: The Tech Effect S1 - "Future Aviation"
programme.desc: In this episode we examine advances in aviation that include flying cars being developed by Slovakian and Japanese companies. Ride share companies are also considering aerial options.

programme.title: The Tech Effect S1 - "Space Tourism"
programme.desc: In this episode we travel on a space tourist test flight that flies high above the Earth. It's just one of the options available for wealthy thrill-seekers looking to defy gravity on a trip above our atmosphere.

programme.title: Oddly Satisfying Science S1 - "Don't Believe Your Eyes"
programme.desc: This week's experiments delve into the possibilities of mind control, why objects and people tend to sync together, and the magical mysteries behind magnesium.

programme.title: Oddly Satisfying Science S1 - "The Sound of Science"
programme.desc: This week's experiments hit high notes as we discover the physics of theremins, investigate how the outer ear impacts human hearing, and put on a laser show with cymatics.

programme.title: The New Frontier S3 - "Gravity"
programme.desc: LISA pathfinder, has led the way for a space-based gravity wave detector, what are gravity waves and why are they so hard to detect?

programme.title: The New Frontier S3 - "Interface"
programme.desc: The Ionosphere is little understood, it effects radio communications, GPS signals and satellites alike, it changes between day and night and is influenced from space and from Earth, new satellites have been launched to study this zone.

programme.title: The New Frontier S4 - "The Cryosphere"
programme.desc: New satellites are being launched to continue detailed observations of Earth and its oceans an ice caps, They are finding that climate change is accelerating and they have the data to prove it.

programme.title: The New Frontier S4 - "Set Course for the Heart of the Sun"
programme.sub-title: Set Course for the Heart of the Sun
programme.desc: NASA’S Parker Solar Probe Mission is on its way and will be followed by Europe’s Solar probe Mission. No spacecraft have traveled so fast or so close to a star before. It is hoped to reveal the source of the solar winds that effect us on Earth.

programme.title: How Do They Do It S14 - "Car Shredder, Sarees, Worcestershire Sauce"
programme.desc: How do they build the ultimate car crushing colossus? Plus, how do Lea and Perrins concoct their Worcestershire sauce?
